financials.context_note: The supplied transcript and press release describe the quarter ended April 30, 2023; this information was used for Q2 because those were the only documents provided in the Q2 folder.

highlights: Record accelerated computing revenue fueled by generative AI workloads
DGX H100 shipments and DGX Cloud partnerships with Azure, GCP, OCI
Launched new inference platforms (L4, L40, H100 NVL, Grace Hopper)
Continued RTX 40 Series laptop momentum, RTX 4070 ramp, RTX 4060 family launch
GeForce NOW catalog expansion, including Xbox titles, DLSS game additions
Omniverse Cloud in Azure and new Ada-based RTX GPUs for workstations
DRIVE Orin ramp, $14B design win pipeline, BYD expansion

capital_investment.context: PP&E & intangible investments to support AI infrastructure

capital_return.note: No share repurchases this quarter; opportunistic programs remain

ai_infrastructure: Generative AI demand fueling exponential accelerated computing adoption and supply-chain ramp
Quantum-2 400G InfiniBand, BlueField-3 DPU, Spectrum-4 Ethernet, Grace Hopper, and DGX Cloud momentum
software: NVIDIA AI Foundations, AI Enterprise, and Omniverse platforms guiding enterprises from data to deployment
Partnerships with Microsoft Azure, Google Cloud, Oracle Cloud, ServiceNow, Dell, Adobe, among others

metadata.source: NVDA Q1 FY2024 press release and earnings call transcript (provided in the Q2 folder)
